Brady, self-portrait, circa 1875 | birth_date = 1822 | birth_place = Warren County, New York, U.S.A. | death_date = | death_place = New York City, New York, U.S.A. | spouse = Juliette Handy Brady | occupation = Photographer, photojournalist | signature = Mathew Brady Signature.svg }} Mathew B. Brady (1822 – January 15, 1896) was one of the most celebrated 19th century American photographers, best known for his portraits of celebrities and the documentation of the American Civil War. He is credited with being the father of photojournalism. == References == * == Other websites == * MathewBrady.com * Mathew Brady biography at American Memory of the Library of Congress * Mathew Brady Photographs More than 6,000 photographs available in the Archival Research Catalog of the National Archives and Records Administration * Mathew Brady's World – biography, timeline and analysis of Brady's work at the Smithsonian Institution * Category:American photographers Category:Writers from New York City Category:American journalists Category:Accidental deaths Category:1823 births Category:1896 deaths
